basics.name: Wai Shing Tang
basics.label: Computational Biophysicist
basics.summary: A comptuational biophysicist specializing in molecular simulations, method development, and software engineering. Experienced in high-performance computing, statistical modeling, and data analysis. Passionate about advancing scientific understanding through computational approaches and collaborative research.

work.name: Microsoft Research Cambridge
work.summary: Conducted research on generative molecular models for macromolecular structure prediction, incorporating cryo-EM imaging data into generative molecular models for macromolecular structure prediction.
highlights: Incorporated cryo-EM imaging data into generative molecular models for macromolecular structure prediction.

work.name: Flatiron Institute
work.position: Flatiron Research Fellow at Center of Computational Mathematics (CCM) and Structural Molecular Biophysics group (SMBp)
work.summary: Worked on ensemble refinement from cryo-EM data, software development for cryo-EM data processing, and mentoring interns.
highlights: Developed Bayesian inference methods for extracting conformational heterogeneity from experimental cryo-EM data, resulting in a new statistical framework for ensemble refinement adopted in ongoing collaborative projects.
Worked with experimentalist collaborators to apply methods to real cryo-EM datasets.
Implemented high-throughput, high-performance software for processing large-scale cryo-EM data.

education.institution: The Chinese University of Hong Kong

publications.name: CryoLike: A python package for cryo-electron microscopy image-to-structure likelihood calculations

projects.name: CryoLike
projects.summary: A Python package for Cryo-EM image-to-structure likelihood calculations.
highlights: Implemented high-throughput, high-performance algorithm for processing large-scale cryo-EM data.

projects.name: Ensemble Reweighting using Cryo-EM Particles
projects.summary: Developed Bayesian inference methods for extracting conformational heterogeneity from experimental cryo-EM data, resulting in a new statistical framework for ensemble refinement adopted in ongoing collaborative projects. Worked with experimentalist collaborators to apply methods to real cryo-EM datasets.
highlights: Developed novel Bayesian inference methods for ensemble refinement from cryo-EM data.

projects.name: SINATRA Pro
projects.summary: Thesis research with Lorin Crawford. Protein Structure and Conformation Analysis using Topological Summary Statistics (in Python and C/C++).
highlights: Developed software for protein structure analysis using topological data analysis techniques.
projects.description: Applied topological data analysis and Gaussian-process-based statistical modeling to extract biophysical insights from large-scale molecular dynamics (MD) simulation datasets and identify conformational ensemble differences among protein mutants

projects.name: Refining All-Atom Protein Force Fields for Polar-Rich, Prion-like, Low-Complexity Intrinsically Disordered Proteins
projects.summary: Refined all-atom force field parameters for intrinsically disordered proteins (IDPs). Developed and applied novel approach to visualize the molecular interactions driving phase separation of IDPs.
highlights: Refined all-atom force field parameters for intrinsically disordered proteins (IDPs).

projects.name: Molecular interactions contributing to FUS SYGQ LC/RGG phase separation and co-partitioning with RNA polymerase II heptads
projects.summary: Performed large-scale MD simulation on HPC. Developed and applied novel approach to visualize the molecular interactions driving phase separation of IDPs.
highlights: Performed large-scale MD simulation on HPC.
